All people who grew up in health-conscious childhood homes eat salads regularly.
All people who fulfill their daily nutritional intakes grew up in health-conscious childhood homes.
All people who disregard their physical well-being are not very conscious about their health and eating habits.
If people visit the gym at least once a day, then they always fulfill their daily nutritional intakes.
Taylor either grew up in a health-conscious childhood home and disregard her physical well-being, or she did neither.
conclusions: Taylor neither grew up in a health-conscious childhood home nor does she visit the gym at least once a day.
rationale:
Let:
    H: Taylor grew up in a health-conscious childhood home.
    G: Taylor visits the gym at least once a day.
    S: Taylor eats salads regularly.
    C: Taylor is very conscious about her health and eating habits.
    N: Taylor fulfills her daily nutritional intakes.
    D: Taylor disregards her physical well-being.

Premises:
    (1) All people who eat salads regularly are very conscious about their health and eating habits. (S → C)
    (2) All people who grew up in health-conscious childhood homes eat salads regularly. (H → S)
    (3) All people who fulfill their daily nutritional intakes grew up in health-conscious childhood homes. (N → H)
    (4) All people who disregard their physical well-being are not very conscious about their health and eating habits. (D → ¬C)
    (5) If people visit the gym at least once a day, then they always fulfill their daily nutritional intakes. (G → N)
    (6) Taylor either grew up in a health-conscious childhood home and disregard her physical well-being, or she did neither. (H ∧ D) ∨ (¬H ∧ ¬D)

Conclusion:
    Taylor neither grew up in a health-conscious childhood home nor does she visit the gym at least once a day. (¬H ∧ ¬G)

Logical Chain:
    From (6), we know that either H and D are both true, or both are false.
    If H and D are both true, then from (2) and (4), S and ¬C are both true, which is a contradiction.
    Therefore, H and D must both be false.
    From (3) and (5), if N is true, then H is true, and if G is true, then N is true.
    Since H and D are false, N and G must also be false.
    Therefore, the final conclusion, ¬H ∧ ¬G, is true.

Truth Table:
| H (Grew up in health-conscious home) | G (Visits gym daily) | S (Eats salads regularly) | C (Very conscious about health) | N (Fulfills daily nutritional intakes) | D (Disregards physical well-being) |
|--------------------------------------|----------------------|--------------------------|---------------------------------|-----------------------------------|-----------------------------------|
| False                                | False                | False                     | True                                | False                               | False                               |

<end_of_truth_table>
<answer>
The final answer is (A).
<end_of_answer>
